Reviews.Title: GREAT FIRST DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: HK
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my six year old daughter and it's fabulous.  Easy to use, large screen, lightweight and lots of functions.  So far, no complaints whatsoever.  She absolutely loves it and it takes great photographs.  Great first digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great price, super fast pics!
Reviews.Author: T. Dziagwa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I could have something for Christmas. I have a Nikon Coolpix5700, and I have to get it repaired, so in the interim I bought this camera. First off, I love it becuase it's pink! Second the time between pictures is the fastest I have yet to experience. It's even faster than my Nikon! The picture quality is great also. Though the quality is not as good as my Nikon, I knew that would be the case. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone! Just make sure you have batteries. I would have given this camera an absolute 10 except the battery life goes sooo quickly. In the past, I have had a Kodak Easyshare but I dont remember the model number. It was nothing compared to this camera. I have also had an HP camera, and I would choose this camera over all of the others I have previously had. I was originally planning to just sell this camera on ebay once I got my Nikon fixed, but I'm going to keep them both. I'm using this one for everyday use and keeping my Nikon to do the "special" pictures of my kids. I'm so happy I bought this camera!

Reviews.Title: Would be great, if it worked.
Reviews.Author: VKFlair
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my old Kodak bit the dust.  Saw it on the Kodak Store for 79.99 and was thrilled, by the price and features.  It was cheaper than my old camera, but 5 megapixels instead of 4, had optical zoom, and a bunch of different settings.  I was sold!Not only did it take over a month to ship (this was the Kodak Store, not Amazon), but once I got it, I discovered it didn't work.  The camera is possessed.  Occasionally it will turn on and stay on, but typically as soon as the power button is pressed, it shuts itself right back off.  If it even turns on in the first place.This is exactly what happened to my last camera.I'm sending it back, and hopefully will receive a new/fixed camera, but my hopes are not high.You take your chances with this camera, and with Kodak products in general.  It's a great price, but remember you get what you pay for (and sometimes less).
